page.title: 12Colvend: Housing
page.content: There are no streets or terraces of houses in the area, and hardly any pavements. Each house sits on its own ground with its own garden. The farms all have farm cottages in which their employees live. As there are fewer farm workers nowadays, some of these cottages have been sold or are let to holiday-makers. About one third of the houses are owned by people who live far away from the area. These are either let in the summer holidays or occupied by the owners for only a short time each year. The oldest house in Rockcliffe is Auchenvhin. When it was built 120 years ago it was the only house in the bay, which is now surrounded by houses of all shapes and sizes. To-day new, and very expensive,houses continue to be built in other parts of the area.
